==Events==
*[[331 BC]] &ndash; [[Alexander the Great]] defeats [[Darius III of Persia]] in the [[Battle of Gaugamela]].
* [[959]] &ndash; [[Edgar of England|Edgar the Peaceable]] becomes king of all [[England]].
*[[1189]] &ndash; [[Gerard de Ridefort]], grandmaster of the [[Knights Templar]] since [[1184]], is killed in the [[Siege of Acre (1189–1191)|Siege of Acre]].
*[[1553]] &ndash; Coronation of Queen [[Mary I of England]].
*[[1787]] &ndash; Russians under [[Alexander Suvorov]] defeat the Turks [[Battle of Kinburn (1787)|at Kinburn]].
*[[1791]] &ndash; First session of the [[France|French]] [[Legislative Assembly (France)|Legislative Assembly]].
*[[1795]] &ndash; [[Belgium]] is [[History of Belgium#French period|conquered]] by [[France]].
*[[1800]] &ndash; [[Spain]] cedes [[Louisiana (New France)|Louisiana]] to [[France]] via the [[Third Treaty of San Ildefonso|Treaty of San Ildefonso]].
*[[1811]] &ndash; The first [[steamboat]] to sail the [[Mississippi River]] arrives in [[New Orleans, Louisiana]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; Opening of the [[Congress of Vienna]], intended to redraw [[Europe]]'s political map after the defeat of [[Napoléon]] the previous spring.
*[[1827]] &ndash; [[Russo-Persian War (1826–1828)|Russo-Persian War]]: The Russian army under [[Ivan Paskevich]] storms [[Yerevan]], ending a millennium of Muslim domination in [[Armenia]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; [[South African College]] is founded in [[Cape Town]], [[South Africa]]; it will later separate into the [[University of Cape Town]] and the [[South African College Schools]].
*[[1832]] &ndash; [[Texian]] political delegates [[Convention of 1832|convened]] at [[San Felipe de Austin]] to petition for changes in the governance of [[Mexican Texas]].
*[[1843]] &ndash; The ''[[News of the World]]'' [[Tabloid (newspaper format)#Europe|tabloid]] begins publication in [[London]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[Germany|German]] inventor and industrialist [[Ernst Werner von Siemens|Werner von Siemens]] founds [[Siemens AG]] & Halske.
*[[1854]] &ndash; The watch company founded in [[1850]] in Roxbury by [[Aaron Lufkin Dennison]] relocates to [[Waltham, Massachusetts]], to become the [[Waltham Watch Company]], a pioneer in the [[American system of watch manufacturing]].
*[[1880]] &ndash; [[John Philip Sousa]] becomes leader of the [[United States Marine Band]].
*  1880   &ndash; First electric lamp factory is opened by [[Thomas Edison]].
*[[1887]] &ndash; [[Balochistan (region)|Balochistan]] is conquered by the [[British Empire]].
*[[1890]] &ndash; [[Yosemite National Park]] is established by the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]].
*[[1891]] &ndash; In the [[U.S. state]] of [[California]], [[Stanford University]] opens its doors.
*[[1898]] &ndash; The [[Vienna University of Economics and Business Administration]] is founded under the name ''k.u.k. Exportakademie''.
*[[1903]] &ndash; [[Baseball]]: The [[Boston Americans]] play the [[Pittsburgh Pirates]] in the first game of the modern [[World Series]].
*[[1905]] &ndash; František Pavlík is killed in a demonstration in [[Prague]], inspiring [[Leoš Janáček]] to the piano composition [[1. X. 1905]]. <!-- this date might be ''Julian calendar'', to be checked-->
*[[1908]] &ndash; [[Ford Motor Company|Ford]] puts the [[Ford Model T|Model T]] car on the market at a price of US$825.
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[Los Angeles Times bombing]]: A large bomb destroys the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' building in downtown [[Los Angeles, California]], killing 21.
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Arab]] forces under [[T. E. Lawrence]], also known as "Lawrence of Arabia", capture [[Damascus]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; [[Percy Zachariah Cox|Sir Percy Cox]] lands in [[Basra]] to assume his responsibilities as [[high commissioner]] in [[Iraq]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] introduces its [[First Five-Year Plan (Soviet Union)|First Five-Year Plan]].
*[[1931]] &ndash; The [[George Washington Bridge]] linking [[New Jersey]] and [[New York]] opens.
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Francisco Franco]] is named head of the Nationalist government of [[Spain]].
*[[1937]] &ndash; The [[Japan]]ese city [[Handa, Aichi|Handa]] is founded in [[Aichi Prefecture]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Germany]] annexes the [[Sudetenland]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; After a one-month [[Siege of Warsaw (1939)|Siege of Warsaw]], hostile Nazi forces enter the city.
*[[1940]] &ndash; The [[Pennsylvania Turnpike]], often considered the first [[superhighway]] in the United States, opens to traffic.
*[[1942]] &ndash; {{USS|Grouper|SS-214|6}} torpedoes ''[[Lisbon Maru]]'' not knowing she is carrying British [[prisoner of war|PoWs]] from [[Hong Kong]]
*  1942   &ndash; First flight of the [[Bell Aircraft|Bell]] [[XP-59]] "Aircomet".
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Naples]] falls to [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] soldiers.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Nazism|Nazi]] leaders are sentenced at [[Nuremberg Trials]].
*  1946   &ndash; [[Daegu October Incident]] occurs in [[United States Army Military Government in Korea|Allied occupied Korea]].
*  1946   &ndash; [[Mensa International]] is founded in the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[North American F-86 Sabre]] flies for the first time.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[People's Republic of China]] is established and declared by [[Mao Zedong]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; First appearance of ''[[In God We Trust]]'' on U.S. paper currency.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[NASA]] is created to replace [[National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics|NACA]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[10th anniversary of the People's Republic of China]] is celebrated across the country.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Nigeria]] gains independence from the [[United Kingdom]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The United States [[Defense Intelligence Agency]] (DIA) is formed, becoming the country's first centralized military espionage organization.
*  1961   &ndash; East and West Cameroon merge to form the [[Cameroon|Federal Republic of Cameroon]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; First broadcast of ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson]]''.
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[Free Speech Movement]] is launched on the campus of [[University of California, Berkeley]].
*  1964   &ndash; [[Japan]]ese ''[[Shinkansen]]'' ("bullet trains") begin high-speed rail service from [[Tokyo]] to [[Osaka]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; General [[Suharto]] puts down an apparent coup attempt by the [[30 September Movement]] in Indonesia. 
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[West Coast Airlines Flight 956]] crashes with eighteen fatalities and no survivors 5.5 miles south of [[Wemme, Oregon]].  This accident marks the first loss of a [[DC-9]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; The [[Guyana|Guyanese]] government takes over the British Guiana Broadcasting Service (BGBS).
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Concorde]] breaks the [[sound barrier]] for the first time.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Walt Disney World]] opens near [[Orlando, Florida]], [[United States]].
*  1971   &ndash; The first brain-scan using [[x-ray computed tomography]] (CT or CAT scan) is performed at [[Atkinson Morley Hospital]] in [[Wimbledon, London]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Seychelles]] gain internal self-government. The [[Ellice Islands]] split from [[Gilbert Islands]] and take the name Tuvalu.
*  1975   &ndash; [[Thrilla in Manila]]: [[Muhammad Ali]] defeats [[Joe Frazier]] in a [[boxing]] match in [[Manila]], [[Philippines]].
*  1975   &ndash; [[Al Jackson, Jr.]] ([[Booker T. & the M.G.'s]]), was shot fatally five times in the back in his own home.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Tuvalu]] gains independence from the [[United Kingdom]].
*  1978   &ndash; The [[Voltaic Revolutionary Communist Party]] is founded.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] begins his first pastoral visit to the [[United States]].
*  1979   &ndash; The [[MTR]], the [[rapid transit]] railway system in [[Hong Kong]], opens.
*  1979   &ndash; The [[United States]] returns sovereignty of the [[Panama canal]] to [[Panama]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Helmut Kohl]] replaces [[Helmut Schmidt]] as [[Chancellor of Germany (Federal Republic)|Chancellor of Germany]] through a [[Constructive Vote of No Confidence]].
*  1982   &ndash; [[EPCOT Center]] opens at [[Walt Disney World]] near [[Orlando, Florida]], [[United States]].
*  1982   &ndash; [[Sony]] launches the first consumer [[compact disc]] player (model [[Sony CDP-101|CDP-101]]).
*[[1985]] &ndash; The [[Israeli Air Force]] bombs [[Palestine Liberation Organization]] Headquarters in [[Tunis]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[1987 Whittier Narrows earthquake|Whittier Narrows earthquake]] shakes the [[San Gabriel Valley]], registering as [[Richter magnitude scale|magnitude]] 5.9.
*[[1989]] &ndash; [[Denmark]] introduces the world's first legal modern same-sex [[civil union]] called "registered partnership".
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Siege of Dubrovnik]] begins.
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[Cartoon Network]] begins broadcasting.
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Palau]] gains independence from the [[United Nations]] ([[United Nations Trusteeship Council|trusteeship]] administered by the [[United States of America]]).
*[[2009]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United Kingdom]] takes over the [[judicial functions of the House of Lords]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[2012 Lamma Island ferry collision|ferry collision]] off the coast of [[Hong Kong]] kills 38 people and injures 102 others.
* 2012 &ndash; Domestic and International flights of [[Thai AirAsia]] transferred all operations from [[Suvarnabhumi Airport]] to [[Don Mueang International Airport]] .
*[[2013]] &ndash; The [[Federal government of the United States|U.S. federal government]] [[United States federal government shutdown of 2013|shuts down]] non-essential services after it is unable to pass a budget measure.
